content:
I just saw #19920, which is a feature idea of offering a way to include content to prefill in a compose box in the URL. I can see that being something potentially useful for providing a link (E.g. for how to report a problem or get support). Do we think this is a good idea?

Are there any security concerns with potentially adding a feature of this form? It's something that of course is supported with mailto links in email, but I've not thought about this direction for Zulip before.
That's a neat idea! It could provide a topic (or a tip for how to come up with a topic) and a template for the message.
To simulate this a bit, would we want to use these kinds of links in https://zulip.com/developer-community/ (or elsewhere)?
I'm glad ya'll like the idea! I think it could definitely be usefull for bug reporting/technical question templates.

gmail has a similar functionality, here is an example:
https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?tf=cm&fs=1&to=person@gmail.com&cc=otherperson@gmail.com&su=test+subject&body=this+is+a+test
It would also be great if this allowed the user to create new topics as well

Alya Abbott said:

To simulate this a bit, would we want to use these kinds of links in https://zulip.com/developer-community/ (or elsewhere)?

I could imagine using it on our links to #production help in some future situation where we felt the first response to the vast majority of posts was "You need to tell us X".
I think probably having a #provision help template asking folks to indicate clearly the OS they're using is a specific thing that might be helpful.
That said, we also kinda want folks to not use a fixed topic, but that could potentially be made to work.
I'm thinking the use case would more be links from other places than https://zulip.com/developer-community/, e.g. ones of the form "If you need help with X, ask for help ... Y".
